results.purpose: Recipe management and menu planning workflow for HelloFresh Canada (HFCA) Customer Choice Menu (CCM), tracking weekly recipe configurations, tags, labels, and promotional campaigns
key_data_points: Regional surcharges: ON only MOD, AB & BC only surcharges (slots 1301, 1302)
Current active campaigns: Winter Warmers (W46-47), The Office (W43-44), Fall Flavours (W39-46), Global Cuisine (W38-40)

entities.name: HelloFresh Canada (HFCA)
entities.context: Primary brand for this recipe management system

entities.name: CCM (Customer Choice Menu)
entities.context: Menu management platform where recipes are uploaded and activated

entities.name: HC (HelloChef)
entities.context: Team/system responsible for uploading menu weeks into CCM

entities.name: MP (Menu Planning)
entities.context: Team that identifies recipe classifications and posts in #hfc_weekly_menuplanning Slack channel

entities.name: Naomi Harper
entities.context: Contact for Protein Plus label logic questions (W10+ 2025)

entities.name: Cat & Nat
entities.context: Partnership campaign running W36-39 2025

entities.name: CPS
entities.context: System where missing recipe information must be updated

insights: Complex multi-step QA process: Initial setup (T-1 week) → HC upload → Pre-activation check → Post-activation live QA → Manual corrections at T-2
Heavy reliance on manual data entry and cross-referencing between Product Calendar, Slack (#hfc_weekly_menuplanning), and CCM system
Regional customization: Different surcharges and MOD availability by province (ON, AB, BC)
Seasonal and promotional campaigns drive tag/label requirements with specific week ranges

Recipe taxonomy includes multiple classification systems: tags (Veggie, Family Friendly, Spicy, etc.), labels (Discovery, Perfect Pair, Super Quick), and product lines (Health, Carb Smart, Cal Smart, Protein Plus)
Slot 1038 has dynamic Veggie classification requiring manual Slack verification each week
Data integrity critical: Must update both current and future recipe versions, copy/paste values to lock in data
Transition from 'feel-good' to TAG logic for Protein Plus occurred at W10 2025
15-minute meal slots were reintroduced at W36 2024 after previous removal

results.purpose: Tracks product analytics backlog for New Ventures brands (TPT and GoC), including experiment deep dives, dashboard builds, and analysis requests
key_data_points: Deadlines ranging from W47 to W50 2025, and W03-W10 2026
Request types: retention deep dive, CVR deep dive, CVA Calculation, dashboard builds, tracking events

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: Primary brand with 33 requests - appears to be a pet food subscription service

entities.name: GoC
entities.context: Secondary brand with 10 requests - subscription service with OTP and cadence experiments

entities.name: Rena Zhou
entities.context: Owner of multiple Tableau dashboard requests

entities.name: Maria
entities.context: Responsible for multiple prepost analyses

entities.name: Winnie Huang
entities.context: Building dashboards, available from end of December

entities.name: Harsh Maheshwari
entities.context: Building dashboards from mid-December

entities.name: Laurent
entities.context: Owner of Add-ons analysis

entities.name: Statsig
entities.context: Used as starting point for price test analysis

entities.name: Tableau
entities.context: Dashboard platform for multiple retention and analytics dashboards

entities.name: FTC
entities.context: Regulatory body requiring new cancellation page preparation

insights: Heavy focus on retention analysis - 'retention deep dive' appears in 15 requests
Conversion rate (CVR) optimization is a major theme with 13 CVR-related requests
Multiple dashboard build requests indicate need for better self-service analytics infrastructure
TPT brand shows extensive experimentation in funnel optimization (allergens, quiz improvements, meal cards, pricing)
Several Priority 3 items marked as 'Deprio' suggesting resource constraints
GoC brand focusing on OTP (One-Time Purchase) implementation and cadence experiments
Strong emphasis on A/B testing and pre-post analysis methodology
Regulatory compliance driving some work (FTC cancellation page requirements)
Cross-functional dependencies noted with 'Support needed' flags on multiple items
Resource bottleneck indicated by dashboard builds scheduled for mid-to-late December when capacity available

results.purpose: Product development roadmap for Good Chop's 2025/2026 initiatives, tracking strategic projects, sprints, team capacity, and key milestones across quarters
key_data_points: Dev capacity ranges from 5-33 story points across sprints
Legal deadline: July 14 for Funnel and Cancellation deflection
Legal update: all changes by August 18

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Company for which roadmap is created

entities.name: Jay
entities.context: Back to cross-sell, May 1 off

entities.name: Yury
entities.context: Out of office May 8

entities.name: Claudia
entities.context: Returns to team, partly OOO during spike

entities.name: Pame
entities.context: OOO 3 weeks, OOO until 22nd, returns later

entities.name: Areeba
entities.context: Maternity leave until Q4 2026

entities.name: Bolo
entities.context: Paternity leave from October 17 for 3 months

entities.name: Max
entities.context: Team member mentioned with Nvard

entities.name: Nvard
entities.context: Team member

entities.name: Becca
entities.context: Out, then returns

entities.name: Khaled
entities.context: Confirmed UPM Reactivations handled by Payments team

entities.name: Wallet
entities.context: Major initiative with funnel work, error monitoring, campaigns, full launch

entities.name: Dashboard
entities.context: Separate dashboard development (Milestone 1), order summary, premium swap, next delivery

entities.name: Seamless
entities.context: Development on funnel, UAT phases, DIY version

entities.name: Welcome Kit
entities.context: Development, UAT, marketing campaigns launched June 6

entities.name: Search
entities.context: Development with product card redesign, launched June 23

entities.name: One Time Purchase (OTP)
entities.context: MVP spike and development for funnel and post-checkout

entities.name: RAF (Refer-a-Friend)
entities.context: Credit reward at $0, design and product work

entities.name: PCS v2
entities.context: Rolled out July 23 to 20%, then 100% by July 31

entities.name: Wunderkind
entities.context: Fixed cookie sizes July 24

entities.name: Genesys
entities.context: Widget live after CC widget removed July 16

insights: Heavy focus on wallet and payment systems in Q1 with phased rollout (minor work → campaigns → full launch)
Dashboard development paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Significant team capacity fluctuations due to multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO periods)
Legal compliance is a major constraint with multiple deadlines throughout the year
Product development follows a pattern: Spike → Dev → UAT → Bug fixes → Launch
Q2-Q3 focused on customer experience improvements (Seamless, Welcome Kit, Search, Product Cards)
Q4 emphasizes retention and monetization (Reactivations, OTP, Two-week cadence)
Multiple system migrations planned (Voucher, Pricing service, Cash Credits, PCS v2)
Peak season preparation requires extended planning and resource allocation
Cross-functional coordination between Dev, Design, Product, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Experimentation-driven approach with rollback capabilities (e.g., 'No reason' rollback May 23)
Technical debt addressed through deprecation deadlines and system migrations
Customer retention initiatives include persisting free add-ons and reactivation UX improvements

insights: Heavy focus on wallet and payment system improvements in Q1 with full launch and voucher migration
Strategic pause of Dashboard development after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Significant team capacity fluctuations due to multiple team members on leave (maternity, paternity, OOO)
Legal compliance is a major constraint with multiple deadlines throughout the year
Product development follows a phased approach: Spike → Development → UAT → Bug fixes → Launch
Q2 focuses on customer experience improvements (Seamless, Welcome Kit, Search)
Q3-Q4 shift toward retention and monetization (Reactivations, OTP, Two-week cadence)
Multiple system migrations planned for Q4 (Pricing service, Cash Credits, PCS v2)
Peak season preparation starts mid-year with Thanksgiving one-off in Week 45
Team operates on 2-week sprints with 70% capacity allocated to strategic initiatives
Several rollbacks and fixes noted in launch history (e.g., 'No reason' rollback May 23)
Cross-functional coordination between Dev, Design, Product, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Preset V2 release contingent on positive Net Revenue results with 4-week maturity period

results.purpose: Tracks AI-Native pilot and pre-pilot teams, their onboarding status, points of contact, and associated project management links
key_data_points: Most teams lack complete JIRA and DORA metric links
Only 2 teams have DORA metrics links available

entities.name: Pepijn Senders
entities.context: Primary onboarder for 5 out of 7 teams

entities.name: Ebrahim Kargar
entities.context: Co-onboarder for 6 teams and PoC for MarTech Voucher Validation

entities.name: Vadim Shaygorodskiy
entities.context: Co-onboarder for MarTech Voucher Validation

entities.name: MarTech Voucher Validation
entities.context: Pre-pilot team, earliest onboarding (9/14/2025)

entities.name: Engagement DAU
entities.context: Pre-pilot team with Edu Morôni as PoC

entities.name: CCM Bulk Uploads
entities.context: Pre-pilot team with Vimal Garg as PoC

entities.name: Conversions
entities.context: Pilot team with Oleksii Svarychevski as PoC

entities.name: GoodChop
entities.context: Pilot team with Alexander Matlin as PoC, has DORA metrics

entities.name: Squad Checkout
entities.context: Pilot team with Kate Zimina and Vitaliy Shvarz as PoCs, has DORA metrics

entities.name: Cross Selling and Subscription Flexibility
entities.context: Pilot team with incomplete data, no onboarding date

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Organization using Atlassian JIRA and Tableau for tracking

entities.name: JIRA
entities.context: Project management tool, many links noted as 'Can't find link'

entities.name: DORA
entities.context: DevOps metrics tracking via Tableau

insights: Data completeness issue: Most teams are missing JIRA and DORA metric links
Pepijn Senders and Ebrahim Kargar are the primary onboarding team, handling most implementations
Clear progression from Pre-pilot to Pilot status over time (September to November 2025)
Only 2 out of 7 teams (GoodChop and Squad Checkout) have complete DORA metrics tracking
One team (Cross Selling and Subscription Flexibility) is missing critical onboarding date information
Multiple PoCs noted difficulty accessing JIRA links ('Can't find link' appears 3 times)
Teams appear to be from various business domains: marketing, engagement, conversions, checkout, and cross-selling

insights: Roadmap follows agile methodology with 2-week sprints and story point capacity planning
Team capacity significantly impacted by multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO periods) in Q3-Q4
Heavy focus on CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives mid-year, causing pause of new Dashboard work
Legal compliance is a major constraint with multiple deadlines affecting funnel and cancellation flows
Wallet and payment systems are foundational work completed early in roadmap (Q1-Q2)
Product development shifts from infrastructure (Wallet, Dashboard) to customer-facing features (Welcome Kit, Search, OTP) throughout the year
Multiple system migrations planned: Voucher, Pricing service, Cash Credits, PCS v2
Peak season preparation drives timing of several initiatives (Thanksgiving launch W45)
Design and Product teams work ahead of development with handovers and exploration phases
Several rollbacks and fixes noted in launch history (May 23 'No reason' rollback, July fixes for widgets and cart issues)
Cross-functional dependencies evident between Product, Design, PA (Product Analytics), and Dev teams
UPM (likely User Payment Management) Reactivations delegated to separate Payments team

insights: Roadmap follows agile methodology with 2-week sprints and story point capacity planning
Team capacity significantly impacted by multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) in Q3-Q4
Major strategic shift: Dashboard development paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Heavy focus on compliance and legal changes with multiple deadlines throughout the year
Product launches clustered in June-July period (Welcome Kit, Search, Product Cards, PCS v2)
Technical debt addressed through migrations (Voucher, Pricing service, Cash Credits)
Experimentation culture evident with A/B tests, UAT phases, and rollback capabilities
Cross-functional coordination between Dev, Design, Product, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Peak season preparation starts mid-year with Thanksgiving-specific features
Persistent free add-ons feature spans multiple quarters showing complex implementation
Reactivation and retention features prioritized in Q4 (Reactivation UX, OTP)
Search performance (INP resolution) is critical ongoing concern requiring continuous allocation

insights: Heavy focus on wallet and payment system improvements in Q1-Q2 2025
Team capacity significantly impacted by multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) in Q3-Q4
Strategic pivot: Dashboard development paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Compliance and legal changes are major themes with multiple deadlines throughout the year
Product launches follow a pattern: spike → development → UAT → bug fixes → launch
Multiple system migrations planned: Voucher, PCS v2, Pricing service, Cash Credits
Peak season preparation starts mid-year with Thanksgiving one-off in Week 45
Search functionality requires continuous allocation until INP (Interaction to Next Paint) is resolved
Free add-ons feature evolves from grace period end (April 15) to persisting across different user states
Significant technical debt addressed: Price deprecation, system migrations, widget optimizations
Cross-functional coordination between Dev, Design, Product, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Real-time monitoring and rollback capabilities demonstrated (e.g., 'No reason' rollback May 23)
